inclusion.criterion: History of simple or complex partial epilepsy that has been documented or witnessed
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: an electroencephalogram (EEG) during the preceding 5 years that has a pattern consistent with the diagnosis of partial epilepsy
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: during an 8-week baseline phase, patient must have at least 8 partial seizures while maintaining therapeutic levels of antiepileptic drugs (AEDs) and have no more than one seizure-free interval of up to 3 weeks
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: and no seizure-free interval longer than 3 weeks
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Patients having solely generalized seizures or lacking documentation of partial epilepsy
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: patients with generalized tonic-clonic seizures or other generalized epilepsies in the absence of an EEG consistent with partial epilepsy
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: generalized seizures, which are defined by the EEG wave pattern
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: seizures that lack an abnormal pulsation pattern on EEG
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: female patients who are pregnant or nursing, or those not using adequate birth control
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Patient has a history of focal epilepsy with secondary generalization, likely due to anoxic brain injury at birth. He has had seizures since age 13 and was recently tapered off Dilantin.
